benchmark_details.name: TB-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: TB-Bench is a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate Multi-Modal Large Language Models (MLLMs) on understanding traffic behaviors across eight perception tasks from ego-centric views.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of TB-Bench is to rigorously assess MLLM performance across eight distinct perception tasks in the context of autonomous driving.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The study utilizes moderate large language models due to limited computational resources, which could be scaled up.

data.source: The data is generated from existing datasets such as KITTI, ONCE, and Argoverse2, containing ego-centric views of traffic scenarios.
data.size: 2,000 samples for benchmark; TB-100k has 110,000 samples; TB-250k has 250,000 samples.
data.annotation: Question-and-answer pairs are manually constructed and augmented using existing dataset samples.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the response accuracy of the models, using regular expressions for keyword matching.
methodology.interpretation: An accuracy score of 1 indicates a correct prediction; otherwise, the score is 0.
methodology.baseline_results: The proposed models achieve average accuracy up to 85% when fine-tuned with TB-100k.
methodology.validation: Validation procedures include cross-validated performance metrics based on accuracy comparisons with existing models.
